title: Middlebox Communication (MIDCOM) Protocol Semantics
abstract:
This document specifies semantics for a Middlebox Communication (MIDCOM)
protocol to be used by MIDCOM agents for interacting with
middleboxes such as firewalls and Network Address Translators
(NATs).  The semantics discussion does not include any specification
of a concrete syntax or a transport protocol.  However, a concrete
protocol is expected to implement the specified semantics or, more
likely, a superset of it.  The MIDCOM protocol semantics is derived
from the MIDCOM requirements, from the MIDCOM framework, and from
working group decisions.  This document obsoletes RFC 3989.  [STANDARDS-TRACK]
